result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward P. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall have no contact with C.S. dob: 3-28-1989.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain GED, HSED or adult diploma at the discretion of the probation agent.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant may serve jail sentence by electronic monitoring at the discretion of the Sheriff's Dept.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional costs to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 14CF48

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Case No. 14CF48 and 14CF50 called.  Defendant Edward P. Peterson in court with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  Vernon County case 14CF98 will be consolidated into case 14CF48 as Ct. 15. DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 6, 7, & 15 on 14CF48 and Ct. 1 of 14CF50.  Plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.  Court dismissed and read in Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14 in case 14CF48.  Atty Weber makes statement on forfeited bonds.  On 14CF48 Court find DE guilty on Cts. 6, 7, and 15 and orders withheld sentence:  DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 5 months county jail, with Huber; court costs; Letter of apology to all victims, due within 30 days and must be pre-approved by probation agent; no contact with C.S. dob: 3-28-89; Restitution, joint and several; restitution surcharge; Counseling as deemed appropriate be agent; obtain HSED or GED at discretion of agent; Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond be applied to restitution and the additional $3,000.00 signature not be forfeited.  Sentence credit of 3 days.  Court finds DE guilty on Ct. 1 on case 14CF50 and orders a withheld sentence:  Concurrent with 14CF48 - DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 5 months jail with Huber; court costs; DNA sample; DNA surcharge; No contact with C.S. dob: 3-28-89; counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; obtain HSED or GED at discretion of agent.  Sentence credit of 1 day. Atty Weber requests that jail sentence may be served by electronic monitoring.  Court does not object, but at the discretion of the Sheriff's Dept. of that county. ba

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with C.S. - dob:  3-28-89.
Initial appearance on July 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Edward P. Peterson in court, in custody.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $5,000.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with C.S.  Court questions defendant regarding bond.  No objection to bond by defendant.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with C.S.  Next court date scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 2:00 p.m.  The district attorney requested that the clerk's office begin bond revocation proceedings in Case No. 14CF48.  So ordered by the court.  - rt
